items.title: Arab party leaders call to form joint list, oust Netanyahu 'with our own hands'
items.summary: United Arab List leader Mansour Abbas said the Arab parties 'need to stand up courageously and admit our mistakes.' Hadash-Ta'al chairman Ayman Odeh said the fight against Netanyahu 'must be one of all citizens about the way we want to live in a democratic society'

items.title: Should Israel's opposition call Netanyahu a 'traitor'?
items.summary: The words 'treason,' 'betrayal' and 'traitor' are being lobbed at the Israeli prime minister amid new developments in the Qatargate scandal. But referring to politicians as traitors in Israel has a deadly history

items.title: Huckabee takes grandkids to West Bank settlement for archaeological tour, finding 'amazing ancient coins'
items.summary: U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee has been a longtime supporter of Jewish settlements in the West Bank. An Israeli settler leader said the Huckabee family's archaeological discovery is 'the best testimony to our historical right to every part of the Land of Israel'

items.title: Life in Portugal is cheaper and calmer. But can Israelis survive there?
items.summary: Israelis who moved to Portugal before and during the war discovered a place with a very different mentality and a much lower cost of living – if you manage to keep your old Israeli job

items.title: 'Crude and illegitimate': Arab lawmaker calls for police spokesperson to be investigated over TV interview row
items.summary: Lawmaker Ahmad Tibi responded to the police's call to consider opening an investigation into him for calling the police spokesperson a 'nobody' and a 'punk' in a Monday televised interview

items.title: Maccabi Haifa faces disciplinary action after fans display banner referencing pornographic meme at derby
items.summary: Maccabi Haifa fans are accused of displaying a banner that was a visual reproduction of a well-known internet meme originating in a pornographic video; Arab-Israeli team Bnei Sakhnin faces charges over chants invoking Jewish supremacist Meir Kahane

items.title: Bedouin regional council petitions High Court to stop 'heavy-handed' Tarabin police operation
items.summary: The El-Kassum Regional Council argued that the Israel Police, acting under Ben-Gvir's direction in the southern Israeli town of Tarabin, have carried out what it described as 'unilateral, heavy-handed and disproportionate' actions

items.title: At least 35 killed, 1,200 detained in Iran protests as threat of U.S. intervention looms
items.summary: According to the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency, 29 protesters, four children and two members of Iran's security forces have been killed. Demonstrations have reached over 250 locations in 27 of Iran's 31 provinces

items.title: With the help of the Shin Bet, Israel launches anti-AI task force ahead of 2026 elections
items.summary: The team, led by the Shin Bet and Israel's Elections Committee, will work with private companies and vendors in the defensive cybersecurity field and combat threats posed by AI on social media

items.title: 'Spit in the face': Knesset holds event for Oct. 7 families with only pro-Netanyahu groups
items.summary: The conference was described as 'a salute' to those who uplifted the nation during wartime, but families who opposed the government during the war were not invited. Smotrich told Haaretz it was legitimate to 'elevate certain people that, in our view, were on the right side'

items.title: Israeli foreign minister visits Somaliland: 'Unlike "Palestine," it's not a virtual state'
items.summary: Gideon Sa'ar vowed that mutual embassies would be opened, and the president said he had accepted Prime Minister Netanyahu's invitation to visit Israel. The trip comes about two weeks after Israel became the first UN member state to recognize the republic as an independent state

items.title: Trump discussed Turkey's role in postwar Gaza force with Netanyahu in Florida, source says
items.summary: As Israel and the United States struggle to recruit foreign countries willing to send troops to the international stabilization force in Gaza, Israel continues to strongly oppose Turkey's participation in the initiative

items.title: How a quiet Bedouin village in Israel's south turned into Ben-Gvir's supremacist playground
items.summary: 'What we saw in Gaza and the West Bank has reached us, too,' says a relative of Mohammed al-Sana, who was fatally shot by Israel Police officers in Tarabin. Residents say the killing shattered hopes in the village, amid arrests of children and what they describe as collective punishment. 'It proved

items.title: Israeli and Syrian officials hold security talks in Paris with Witkoff and Kushner
items.summary: According to Syria's state news agency SANA, the Syrian delegation is seeking to advance a security deal that would guarantee a full Israeli withdrawal from positions held in southern Syria since December 2024

items.title: After Mamdani takes office, Tel Aviv Stock Exchange courts New York's Israeli tech scene
items.summary: The Tel Aviv Stock Exchange appears to be positioning itself as a stable alternative for Israeli tech companies, marking the opening of trading with New York–based startup founders amid political unease in New York under newly elected Mayor Zohran Mamdani

items.title: Unlike Maduro, Khamenei has leverage – but his regional strategy may imperil the Islamic Republic
items.summary: While the public in Iran is learning to link foreign and security policy with the country's dire economic situation, the Supreme Leader is struggling to safeguard the very legitimacy of the regime and its vision

items.title: Iran hints at preemptive strike on Israel if it sees 'indications of threats'
Man who threatened to shoot ex-prime minister Naftali Bennett jailed for 18 months
items.summary: Dumitru Chirchiali posted a photograph of himself holding a pistol and threatening to shoot the then-prime minister; he also admitted illegal possession of firearms

items.title: History teaches us not to believe the police version of the Tarabin shooting
Hundreds attend funeral of Bedouin man who was shot dead in his village by Israel Police
items.summary: Mohammed Hussein Tarabin al-Sana was killed on Saturday night by a policeman who had come to arrest him as part of a police operation in the village of Tarabin

items.title: Top court gives government one week to respond to contempt claims over Haredi IDF draft
items.summary: A petition filed by Movement for Quality Government argued the government should be held in contempt of court, after authorities missed a 45-day court deadline to formulate a policy forcing draft-age ultra-Orthodox men to enlist. The state was given less than a week to respond

items.title: Arab-Israeli residents of Tarabin are victims of Ben-Gvir's campaign
The 'worthy people' of religious Zionism are endangering Israel's existence
items.summary: Netanyahu isn't being shaken down by far-right ministers Smotrich and Ben-Gvir; in fact, the opposite is true: he's is using them as part of his strategy to extend his time in power. This strategy has brought about the unnecessary extending of the war

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
This financial review will affect every Israeli – and Israel is poised to fail it
items.summary: If it winds up on the international money laundering 'gray list,' Israel could see a drop in investments and more expensive bank transactions. If you think that banks charge excessive fees now, be prepared for a big increase – and this time, the banks won't be to blame

items.title: Bank of Israel lowers benchmark interest to 4 percent in surprise move
items.summary: This was the second consecutive reduction of this key interest rate in two months. In an earlier survey, a decisive majority of analysts estimated that the bank would not reduce the key interest – 'It's difficult to explain the bank's change of direction'

items.title: Is Naftali Bennett really liberal Israel's answer to Netanyahu?
items.summary: Bennett has become the darling of the liberal camp, but let there be no mistake: When he speaks of a 'Zionist coalition' without Arabs or ultra-Orthodox parties, numbering 90 members, it implicitly includes Ben-Gvir's Otzma Yehudit and Smotrich's Religious Zionism

items.title: Police seek criminal probe into Arab MK for calling police spokesman 'nobody' in debate
items.summary: In a TV interview with Channel 13 journalist Lucy Aharish, Tibi called Israel Police a "mob," condemning its killing of an Arab-Israeli man in the Bedouin village Tarabin overnight into Sunday

items.title: Venezuela to Gaza: How colonial rule brings Trump and Netanyahu together
items.summary: Both Israel and America have always forcefully rejected the accusation that they are motivated by a colonial impulse. But both Trump and Netanyahu now embrace the belief that power grants them the right to rule others without their consent

items.title: From Gaza aid groups to Haaretz: The shrinking space for 'legitimate criticism' of Israel
items.summary: This government's hunger for control over the narrative will not end with international NGOs and foreign media, who dare cross the arbitrary line drawn by Israel's far-right leadership

items.title: Israeli ministry report on Doctors Without Borders alleges Gaza terror links – with scant proof
items.summary: After revoking the medical charity's license, Israel's Ministry of Diaspora Affairs published a 25-page report accusing it of employing Hamas militants in Gaza and scrutinizing its social media posts. Doctors Without Borders says it supports one in five of Gaza's hospital beds

items.title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at the age of 96
items.summary: Schloss, who endured Auschwitz and lifelong trauma, devoted decades to Holocaust education. Chief executive director of the Anne Frank Trust U.K, which she co-founded, said 'her legacy will continue to guide and empower young people to build a world free from hatred and discrimination'

items.title: Syria, Israel to resume U.S. mediated-talks to reach security agreement, diplomatic source says
items.summary: The negotiations, centered on land occupied by Israel after the fall of the Assad regime, will take place in Paris on Tuesday, the source told Haaretz. The French foreign minister is expected to meet with his Syrian counterpart in Paris earlier

items.title: IDF says soldier filmed firing machine gun into Gaza violated protocol, vows to investigate
items.summary: The soldier had violated protocol, the IDF said, noting it had opened an investigation. In the video, the unidentified soldier can be seen firing an IWI Negev machine gun across a barbed wire fence

items.title: Netanyahu says Israel won't let Iran rebuild nuclear, missile programs
items.summary: Speaking at the Knesset, the prime minister said 'the consequences will be very severe' if Iran were to attack Israel

items.title: Israeli soccer star Manor Solomon shines in Italian debut, after his transfer draws local backlash
items.summary: The 26-year-old helped the club score its second win of the season, as Fiorentina reached a critical crossroad in Italy's top league. A local politician criticized the group's signing of an Israeli player, but Solomon – dogged by controversy over his nationality in the past – did not respond

items.title: Israel Police seek lawyers' correspondence as probe of ex-IDF legal chief nears end
items.summary: Investigators are reviewing correspondence between Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi and her attorneys, despite attorney-client privilege, as part of a probe tied to a leaked detainee-abuse video. Police Commissioner Danny Levy blocked public disclosure and postponed closing the investigation

items.title: Four reported killed in strike on Gaza tent; IDF says it struck 'Hamas terrorist'
items.summary: The IDF has killed on average three Palestinians in Gaza per day since the beginning of December. Last week, the United Kingdom, France, and Canada condemned Israel's decision to shutter dozens of international NGOs providing aid to Palestinians in Gaza

items.title: Arkia's new Hanoi route marks Israel-Vietnam air travel milestone
items.summary: The new route could boost Israeli tourism and business ties with Vietnam, supporting joint ventures, cultural exchange, and travel for tech and trade sectors, as Hanoi strengthens its role as a Southeast Asian hub amid the country's record 21.2 million visitors in 2025

items.title: Report: Erdoğan calls for Turkish return into U.S.-led F-35 program
items.summary: President Erdoğan said, 'Turkey's receipt of the F-35 aircraft for which it has already paid,' adding that its reintegration is 'important' for NATO's defense. Israeli officials fear that the acquisition could erode Israel's long-standing qualitative military edge in the region

items.title: Pro-Palestinian activists break into and vandalize aerospace firm in Scotland
items.summary: Footage shows activists smashing servers and spray-painting 'there's only one way this ends,' part of a growing wave of pro-Palestinian actions targeting European firms linked to Israeli defense

items.title: Netanyahu wants to tango with Latin America after the Venezuela takeover. But the music may change
items.summary: Recent elections across South America and Trump's invasion of Venezuela have prompted Israel to court governments across the continent. But key countries remain hostile, and Netanyahu's declaring a 'sweeping turnaround' may be premature

items.title: 'Expression of hatred and intimidation': Arson attack targets German antisemitism commissioner
items.summary: Authorities say perpetrators set fire to a building belonging to Andreas Büttner, and painted a red triangle resembling the Hamas symbol on an adjacent shed. The commissioner responded that such attacks 'do not lead to me becoming quieter – they only strengthen my resolve'

items.title: After undercover probe, Israel to indict Arab-Israeli crime boss, 10 associates
items.summary: Police say a year-long covert operation into the Abu Latif crime family relied on a state witnesswho infiltrated the network and helped amass evidence against senior figures. Authorities described the organization as one of the country's most violent, tied to years of deadly turf wars

items.title: Israeli and foreign banks block aid to Gaza, pushing donors into crypto
items.summary: Several financial institutions fear that the money will reach terrorist organizations and are legally obligated to prevent this

items.title: 'Embarking on a new path': United Arab List leader to allow Jewish candidates on slate
items.summary: By opening the United Arab List to Jewish candidates and breaking from the Islamic Movement, party chair Mansour Abbas seeks to recast the party as a cross-community, civic force, while ruling out Likud alliances and positioning it as a critic of extremist government policies affecting Arab citizens

items.title: Qatargate suspect plans to meet Netanyahu after ban from PM's office expires, lawyers say
items.summary: Police appealed to a judge who refused to extend the restrictions barring Yonatan Urich from the Prime Minister's Office, citing a 'reasonable basis for fearing that Urich's continued employment poses a danger to public safety or may facilitate the commission of a similar offense'

items.title: Landlord denies claim Chabad house in Nepal closed over rising hostility to Israel
items.summary: In an interview with Haaretz, Saput Sherchand, who inherited the property from his father, said the Chabad couple who ran the facility were habitually late in paying their rent. The couple and Sherchand subsequently issued a joint statement saying the issue had been resolved

items.title: Police to summon Israeli ministers and senior civil servants to testify in Qatargate
items.summary: The top officials are set to be summoned over difficulties investigating lobbyist Jay Footlik, to better understand the connection between the ministers and senior officials and the American businessman who served as a lobbyist for Qatar

items.title: Israeli citizen Charlotte Niddam killed in Swiss New Year's Eve ski-resort fire
items.summary: Charlotte Nidam was a joint British-French-Israeli national. Swiss authorities are investigating whether celebratory candles or unsafe ceiling materials triggered the blaze that killed 40 and injured more than 100

items.title: Earliest cremation in Africa 9,550 years ago discovered in Malawi
items.summary: Hunter-gatherers came together and built a pyre to burn a woman in a rock shelter, and lit fires there for hundreds of years

items.title: 'Your days are numbered': Threats against state prosecutor, top court spray-painted on Army Radio wall
items.summary: The threatening graffiti comes amid a government push to close Army Radio due to its 'political and divisive content', and broader coalition efforts to circumscribe freedom of the press in Israel. Late last year, similar grafitti turned up on Haaretz's building and on Channel 13's studio

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
Heed the call of former Supreme Court President Aharon Barak
items.summary: In a video message to anti-government protesters in Tel Aviv, Barak emphasized that the court alone cannot stop the Netanyahu government's destruction of Israeli democracy – the public must act, because 'our life's work is in danger'

items.title: 49-year-old woman stabbed to death by husband in alleged femicide in Pardes Hannah
items.summary: Two of the couple's five children were home during the murder, and a complaint had been filed against the husband for violence toward family members in the past. This marks the first femicide of 2026, as last year's murder rates reached a record-high of 307

items.title: Netanyahu says Israel won't let Iran rebuild nuclear programs: 'Severe consequences'
We must take the next election seriously, it may be Israel's last
items.summary: No one in the government is behaving as if there is a real threat to their seat. Rebuilding voter confidence, including that of their supporters, is not a goal. This is not the behavior of a leadership that plans to win an election fairly

items.title: Jerusalem braces for Ramadan after Ben-Gvir installs controversial ally as city's top cop
items.summary: Despite misconduct allegations, Maj. Gen Avshalom Peled was sworn in on Sunday and will oversee law enforcement in a district with over one million people at a time of rising tensions exacerbated by National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, just weeks away from the Ramadan holiday

items.title: Why Israel's left is also to blame for Gaza war crimes
items.summary: A recent poll reveals that nearly half of Israelis on the left highly rate the military's moral conduct in the war in Gaza. If this is the group expected to oppose the immoral use of force, then the left did not fail in its criticism, it relinquished the need for it

items.title: Be'er Sheva District Court President Benny Sagi killed in traffic accident
items.summary: The court president died Sunday after colliding with an off-road vehicle on Route 6. He was 54 and remembered for his decades-long legal career and high-profile rulings

items.title: IDF prepares for rebuilding of West Bank settlements dismantled in 2005
items.summary: The IDF is establishing new bases in the northern West Bank to secure settlements expected to be established in the region following the repeal of the 2005 Disengagement Act, a move Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said will 'erase the shame of expulsion'

items.title: Tehran reportedly admits regime is in 'survival mode' over protests, as Trump threatens intervention
items.summary: Violence surrounding the demonstrations sparked by Iran's ailing economy has killed at least 19 people, Iran Human Rights reported Sunday, as Trump warned that the United States would respond with force if Tehran starts 'killing people like they have in the past'

items.title: Netanyahu backs Ben-Gvir allowing Jewish prayer at Temple Mount, denies status quo breach
items.summary: The prime minister said policy changes led by the national security minister allowing Jewish prayer at the Al-Aqsa/Temple Mount compound were coordinated with him, dismissing warnings that the moves breach decades-old arrangements

items.title: Might makes right: Israel embraces Trump's 'Donroe Doctrine' at its own peril
items.summary: America's attempted takedown of Venezuela's leadership appears to many in Jerusalem – certainly within Netanyahu's orbit – as a straightforward win for Israel. Yet a world of cruel realism and naked power politics is dangerous for Israel in the long term

items.title: How Russia’s Invasion is Impacting Ukraine’s Youth
items.summary: Last month, in the dead of a cold Autumn night, residents in the Ukrainian town of Balakliia were woken by the sound of two massive explosions. Social media footage showed apartments ablaze, balconies obliterated and a deep crater smouldering in a parking lot. Three people were killed and 13 injured
